Question: Let Reema have '$x$' litres of juice. Reema fills juice in $13$ bottles of $10$ litre volume. Select correct operation to solve for '$x$'.
Solution_text:
Reema had $'x'$ litres of juice which will fill
into $13$ bottles of $10$ litre volume.
We want to find '$x$'
Therefore we write ,
$( x \div 13 ) = 10 $
$( x \div 13 ) \times 13 = 10 \times 13$ ,by multiplying $13$ on both sides

Question: Let Reema have '$c$' pedas . Reema distributed pedas among $10$ students and each student got $10$ pedas. Select correct operation to solve for '$c$'.
Solution_text:
Reema had '$c$' pedas which was distributed to $10$ students. Each student recieves $10$ pedas.
We want to find '$c$'
Therefore we write ,
$( c \div 10 ) = 10 $
$( c \div 10 ) \times 10 = 10 \times 10$ ,by multiplying $10$ on both sides

Question: Let Rohan have '$n$' samosa . Rohan distributed samosa among $13$ students and each student got $13$ samosa. Select correct operation to solve for '$n$'.
Solution_text:
Rohan had '$n$' samosa which was distributed to $13$ students. Each student recieves $13$ samosa.
We want to find '$n$'
Therefore we write ,
$( n \div 13 ) = 13 $
$( n \div 13 ) \times 13 = 13 \times 13$ ,by multiplying $13$ on both sides

Question: Let Rohan have '$c$' icecreams . Rohan distributed icecreams among $2$ students and each student got $14$ icecreams. Select correct operation to solve for '$c$'.
Solution_text:
Rohan had '$c$' icecreams which was distributed to $2$ students. Each student recieves $14$ icecreams.
We want to find '$c$'
Therefore we write ,
$( c \div 2 ) = 14 $
$( c \div 2 ) \times 2 = 14 \times 2$ ,by multiplying $2$ on both sides

Question: Let Seema have '$q$' ladoo . Seema distributed ladoo among $4$ students and each student got $6$ ladoo. Select correct operation to solve for '$q$'.
Solution_text:
Seema had '$q$' ladoo which was distributed to $4$ students. Each student recieves $6$ ladoo.
We want to find '$q$'
Therefore we write ,
$( q \div 4 ) = 6 $
$( q \div 4 ) \times 4 = 6 \times 4$ ,by multiplying $4$ on both sides
